solution_line_template: Since humans have {human_legs} legs, we start by finding out what double that amount is by performing {human_legs}*{double_factor}=<<{human_legs}*{double_factor}={doubled_human_legs}>>{doubled_human_legs}
Spiders have twice that number, so we multiply {doubled_human_legs}*{times_more_factor} to find {spider_legs} legs in total.
